title: 113_hr1946
content: The Act titled "Responsible Student Loan Solutions Act" aims to address student loan affordability. The "Responsible Student Loan Solutions Act" amends the Higher Education Act of 1965 to set new limits on Federal Direct Stafford Loans, capping the aggregate unpaid principal amount at $31,000 for dependent students. The "Responsible Student Loan Solutions Act" sets new limits on Federal Direct Stafford Loans, capping the aggregate unpaid principal amount at $31,000 for dependent students and $57,500 for independent students or undergraduate dependent students whose parents cannot borrow under the Federal Direct PLUS Loan Program. For Direct Stafford Loans first disbursed on or after July 1, 2013, the maximum annual borrowing limit for dependent undergraduate students who have not completed their first year of study is $5,500. For Direct Stafford Loans first disbursed on or after July 1, 2013, the maximum annual borrowing limit for dependent undergraduate students who have not completed their first year of study is $5,500. In cases where students have completed certain years of undergraduate education but not the full program, additional loan amounts are available, such as $6,500 for completing the first year, $7,500 for completing the first and second years. Independent students or dependent students whose parents cannot borrow under the Federal Direct PLUS Loan Program also have specific loan options. The Federal Direct PLUS Loan Program offers varying loan amounts based on the completion of undergraduate education levels: $9,500 for first-year students, $10,500 for those who completed the first year but not the full program, and $12,500 for students who completed the first and second years but not the full program. The Federal Direct PLUS Loan Program offers different loan amounts based on undergraduate education levels completed. Changes were made to interest rates for new loans after July 1, 2013. The Federal Direct PLUS Loan Program offers varying loan amounts based on undergraduate education levels completed. Interest rates for new loans after July 1, 2013 are determined based on the bond equivalent rate of 91-day Treasury bills auctioned at the final auction held prior to June 1, plus a percentage. The interest rate for Federal Direct Unsubsidized Stafford Loans first disbursed on or after July 1, 2013, is determined based on the bond equivalent rate of 91-day Treasury bills auctioned before June 1, plus a percentage capped at 6.8 percent. For Federal Direct PLUS Loans first disbursed on or after July 1, 2013, the interest rate is determined based on the bond equivalent rate of 91-day Treasury bills auctioned before June 1, plus a percentage capped at 8.25 percent. For Federal Direct Consolidation Loans first disbursed on or after July 1, 2013, the interest rate is determined based on the bond equivalent rate of 91-day Treasury bills auctioned before June 1, plus a percentage capped at 8.25 percent. The interest rate for Federal Direct Consolidation Loans first disbursed on or after July 1, 2013, is determined based on the bond equivalent rate of 91-day Treasury bills auctioned before June 1, plus a percentage capped at 8.25 percent, with the Secretary determining the specific percentage for each 12-month period. In July 2013, the origination fee for Federal Direct PLUS Loans was reduced to a maximum of 3 percent of the loan amount. Additionally, the Federal Direct Loan program aims to be revenue neutral by covering the total cost of administration and borrower benefits. "SEC. 460A. REFINANCING." Refinancing for PLUS Loans allows the Secretary to reissue or purchase Federal Direct PLUS Loans that are not in default before July 1, 2013, to obtain a lower interest rate. An administrative fee of up to 0.5 percent of the loan amount may be charged to cover the costs. The Secretary can reissue or purchase Federal Direct Stafford Loans before July 1, 2013, that are not in default to obtain a lower interest rate. An administrative fee of up to 0.5 percent of the principal may be charged to the borrower. The borrower may be charged an administrative fee of up to 0.5 percent of the loan amount for reissuing or purchasing Federal Direct Stafford Loans before July 1, 2013.
